page.title: 12HARVEST SUPPER
page.content: Each year the church and village of Bishop Middleham celebrates the Harvest. This consists of a church service in St Michael's and is usually held on a Thursday evening in October. The church is well decorated with flowers,fruit and vegetables. The service itself is very traditional with Harvest hymns and readings. Usually there is a guest vicar to give the sermon. After the service there is a Harvest Supper held in the village hall, which normally consists of pies and peas provided by the local butcher. Everyone is seated at long tables with a 'top' table being reserved for the vicar and his guests. Speeches follow and traditionally the results are announced of the churchyard competition, which the village often wins.
